title: Beware
text: This app changed the shipping address I had already entered before I put in my billing information and I didn’t know this was done until the order was confirmed.  I was shipping to my daughter and now there is no way to cancel or change the shipping address.  There is also no way to contact anyone quickly with this third party app so I am sure I will receive an email tomorrow to either blame me for “missing” the opportunity to change the shipping address (which there wasn’t) and/or apologize and “better luck next time”.  Unless this is changed, I won’t be using nor recommending this app.

title: Slow updates and privacy concerns
text:
Shop is okay for basic functions such as having all of your orders in one place but it often doesn’t update tracking in real time. 

IMO what’s the point of a tracking app that doesn’t consistently tell you when your orders are delivered? If FedEx/UPS/USPS can send a text after delivery, why can’t Shop auto update the status on their end as well?

Echoing what others have said re: privacy concerns, this app does ask for total access to your email which seems excessive. On top of that, there’s an overall impression that without shop being able to comb through your emails, then they will not be able to update tracking info in real time. Shop (by Shopify) should be getting their tracking updates directly from the carrier (or ship station) just like everyone else.

title: Good but there’s one thing that needs to be fixed

title: A decent tracker, but not great.
text:
I’ve been a long-time user of Parcel, but when a seller suggested using Arrive, I chose to give it a shot. It does do a better job than Parcel at identifying deliveries, but at the cost of rummaging through all of your email. It did find and identify some deliveries I hadn’t seen, but I think I prefer setting up filters to forward only the delivery messages.

Where Arrive really comes up short is keeping up with delivery status. Arrive shows that a package is arriving today, but is still 160 miles away near Dallas. Parcel shows that the package was put on a truck 10 miles away for delivery. For some packages this is a difference between staying in the office or working from home to accept delivery. The $3/year charge for unlimited deliveries in Parcel is well worth it.

title: Great app with a glitch or two
text:
Overall I’ve really enjoyed using this app.  It intelligently identifies items purchased online through my email confirmations and then tracks the delivery for all of my packages in one place.  Genius idea and simple and easy to use!

The one issue I encountered was due to a duplicate record on one of my items.  The first record continued to update with tracking information until delivery, but the second record still shows it as pending tracking info.  This wouldn’t be a problem except that I don’t see any way to delete the duplicate record, so it remains on my pending deliveries list. ☹️

Obviously this doesn’t affect the overall effectiveness of the app, but I’m anal, and I want that erroneous record to be removed. Can you please add an option to delete records?

Another idea I had was to include a feature to “hide” certain packages.  Sometimes my wife or kids may use my phone, so it would be nice if I could hide details for packages that are presents.  Maybe even with a passcode feature to view those records.  It would certainly be helpful during the holiday season!

title: It's a trap!
text:

title: Incoherent changes
text:

I used to use it all the time, but it has become incredibly user-‘unfriendly’ due to the lack of overall understanding of what we need in the app. 

The app’s main purpose is to track orders from multiple vendors, NOT to be a doorway to those vendors. 

If we were too dumb to get to those vendors in the first place, how did I get there before you knew I placed an order, that your app is supposed to track? 

Enough with the main screen interface of showing me all your partners, while it may be a ‘nice’ feature, it’s discouraging me from using your app more often.

title: Very convenient
text: It’s a great app, and makes everything easier when you buy things online from different places. Instead of looking through your emails to find each tracking number, it’s all in one place. However, I gave it 4 stars because the map portion of where the package is could use some work. For example I have a package that arrived in the postal area near me, but on the map it still shows it somewhere else. And there are other things as well, sometimes you have to manually input the information (tracking number, carrier, and name) instead of it already being there. I don’t mind it because it only happens sometimes, not all the time.

title: Horrible Algoritm
text: I installed this app to buy instruments, accessories, and other music related things from music related sellers. You’d think the “picked for you” section would be full of music stuff, but no, it’s all political and military stuff. You’d think holding down and selecting “Not interested” would tell the algorithm that I don’t care for this stuff, but after doing that and refreshing three times, clearing three whole pages, it continues to suggest the same type of thing. Focus your algorithm about what people have actually purchased instead of random stuff like this.
